text: Extrapolating back to the star of the Universe involves going to energies million million times higher than our experiments on Earth.

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: The large scales anomalies seem to be aligned in a weird way - which so far isn't explained.

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: But there are some oddities - on very large scales the sky looks a little bit wrong. Seen with WMAP but now known to be really there.

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: There is no support for weird physics in terms of extra types of neutrinos or changes in dark energy over time

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: My data has shown that they are indeed smaller at smaller scales - as predicted by inflation!

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: We used to think that the primordial fluctuations should be the same on all scales - inflation predicts they shouldn't

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: The age of the Universe is estimated to be 13.82 billion years older - accurate to 0.3%

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

text: It agrees very well with models, and allows us to test the composition of the Universe.

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
user.name: ESA Planck

user.description: A European Space Agency (ESA) spacecraft to understand the origin and evolution of our Universe
